structure.unit: Real And Personal Property And Domestic Relations

law.catch_line: Recording System; Procurement Of Law Books, Stationery, Etc.
law.text: [ Text of section effective until July 1, 2012. For text effective July 1, 2012, see below.] At the trial of any issue of fact, the justice presiding at the trial shall provide for a proper recording system which shall record the proceedings. The cost of said recording system shall be paid by the commonwealth upon the certificate of the chief justice for administration and management. Each clerk of the housing court department may procure law books and blank books, blanks, stationery and other incidentals required by the divisions of the housing court department as the chief justice for administration and management may approve. Chapter 185C: Recording system; procurement of law books, stationery, etc. [ Text of section as amended by 2011, 93, Sec. 36 effective July 1, 2012. See 2011, 93, Sec. 137. For text effective until July 1, 2012, see above.] At the trial of any issue of fact, the justice presiding at the trial shall provide for a proper recording system which shall record the proceedings. The cost of said recording system shall be paid by the commonwealth upon the certificate of the court administrator. Each clerk of the housing court department may procure law books and blank books, blanks, stationery and other incidentals required by the divisions of the housing court department as the court administrator may approve.
